sen.j: 大友 親世（おおとも ちかよ、生年不詳 - 1418年4月1日（応永25年2月25日 (旧暦)））は南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代前期にかけての守護大名。
sen.e: OTOMO Chikayo (Birth date unknown-1418 April 1st) was a Shugo Daimyo (Guardian Feudal Lord) during the Nanbokucho Era (the period of Northern and Southern Courts in Japan) and Muromachi Era
Chikayo OTOMO (Birth date unknown - April 1, 1418) was a Shugo Daimyo (Guardian Feudal Lord) over the period of Northern and Southern Courts in Japan and Muromachi Period.

He was the 10th leader of the Otomo clan.
He was the 10th family head of the Otomo clan.

sen.j: 第8代当主・大友氏時の子。
sen.e: He was the son of the 8th clan leader, OTOMO Ujitoki.

sen.j: 子に第12代当主大友持直、第14代当主大友親隆。
sen.e: The 12th clan leader, OTOMO Mochinao, and the 14th clan leader, OTOMO Chikataka, were his sons.
The 12th family head, Mochinao OTOMO, and the 14th family head, Chikataka OTOMO, were his sons.

sen.j: 1368年、父の氏時が死去した後、その後を継いだ大友氏継が南朝 (日本)方に味方したので、その後を受けて同年のうちに当主となった。
sen.e: In 1368, after the death of his father, his father's successor, OTOMO Ujitsugu, allied himself with the Nancho (Southern Court), and so within the same year Chikayo was made the head of the family.
In 1368, after the death of his father, his father's successor, Ujitsugu OTOMO, allied himself with the Nancho (Southern Court), and in the same year Chikayo was made to be the head of the family.

sen.e: In 1368, after the death of his father, his father's successor, Ujitsugu OTOMO, allied himself with the Nancho (Southern Court), and in the same year Chikayo was made to be the head of the family.

sen.j: その後、足利義満の命を受けて九州探題として赴任してきた今川貞世（了俊）の九州平定に協力して南朝勢力の排除に努めたが、次第に了俊の勢力が拡大してきたことを恐れ、将軍の義満や義父の義弘と共謀して了俊の失脚に一役を買った。
sen.e: He then aided IMAGAWA Sadayo (Ryoshun), who was sent as a Kyushu Tandai (commissioner) by ASHIKAGA Yoshimitsu, in stabilizing Kyushu and uprooting the Nancho forces, but gradually grew afraid of Ryoshun's increasing power, and worked with the Shogun Yoshimitsu, and his own stepfather, Yoshihiro, to bring Ryoshun down.

sen.j: その後も幕府に仕えて功績を挙げ、豊後の守護職の他に検非違使や惣追捕使などにも叙任されている。
sen.e: He continued to serve the government and after many great achievements was made governor of Bungo Province, and was further given the titles of Kebiishi (official with judicial power) and Sotsuibushi (official in charge of police and military roles).

sen.j: 1418年に死去し、後を甥の大友親著が継いだ。
